_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:19:58 using v2.0
title: Have there been changes in support for community mental health service users?
analysis_commentary:
Community and mental health service users were asked about the support they received. Of all the support types mentioned, help in finding or keeping work was the least supported, as reported by the service users in all years (43% said they did not get any support in 2011, 44% in 2012 and 43% in 2013).

For the different support areas, physical health needs had the highest proportion of people feeling supported. However, this decreased by 6% over the three years from 2011 to 2013.

With the exception of help in finding or keeping work, the response to these questions has got slightly worse over time, with a larger proportion not feeling supported in 2013 compared to 2011.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
